00001 /**
00002  * \file RandomThread.cpp
00003  * \brief Example of parallelization with %RandomLib using threads
00004  *
00005  * Compile/link with, e.g.,\n
00006  * g++ -I../include -O2 -funroll-loops -fopenmp
00007  *   -o RandomThread RandomThread.cpp ../src/Random.cpp\n
00008  * ./RandomThread
00009  *
00010  * $Id: 30e9c3974e94e95b899af0ab868584874708fcf4 $
00011  *
00012  * See \ref parallel, for a description of this example.
00013  *
00014  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2011) <charles@karney.com> and licensed under
00015  * the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00016  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00017  **********************************************************************/
00018 
00019 #include <iostream>
00020 #include <iomanip>
00021 #include <limits>
00022 #include <vector>
00023 #include <string>
00024 #include <sstream>
00025 #include <numeric>
00026 
00027 #include <RandomLib/Random.hpp>
00028 #if HAVE_OPENMP
00029 #include <omp.h>
00030 #endif
00031 
00032 using RandomLib::Random;
00033 
00034 double dotrials(Random& r, int d, long long n) {
00035   // Require d > 0, n > 0
00036   double w = 0;
00037   for ( ; n--; ) {              // Iterate n times
00038     double h = 0;
00039     for (int i = 1; i < d; ++i) { // Iterate d-1 times
00040       double x = 2 * r.FixedS();  // x is in (-1, 1)
00041       h += x * x;                 // cumulative radius^2
00042       if (h >= 1) break;          // Point can't be in sphere; bail out,
00043     }
00044     // If h < 1 then inside a (d-1) dimensional unit sphere at radius
00045     // sqrt(h), so extent of last dimension is +/- sqrt(1 -h)
00046     w += h < 1 ? sqrt(1 - h) : 0;
00047   }
00048   return w;
00049 }
00050 
00051 double result(int d, long long n, double w) {
00052   // Volume of (d-1) dimensional box = 2^(d-1).
00053   // Multiply by another 2 to account for +/- extent in last dimension.
00054   return double(1U << d) * w / double(n);
00055 }
00056 
00057 int usage(const std::string& name, int retval) {
00058   ( retval == 0 ? std::cout : std::cerr )
00059     << "Usage: \n" << name
00060     << " [-d dim] [-n nsamp] [-k ntask] [-l stride] [-s seed] [-h]\n"
00061     << "Estimate volume of n-dimensional unit sphere\n";
00062   return retval;
00063 }
00064 
00065 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00066   int d = 4;                    // Number of dimensions
00067   long long n = 10000000;       // Number of trials 10^7
00068   int k = 100;                  // Number of tasks
00069   int l = 4;                    // The leapfrogging stride
00070   std::string seedstr;
00071   bool seedgiven = false;
00072 
00073   for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00074     std::string arg(argv[m]);
00075     if (arg == "-d") {
00076       if (++m == argc) return usage(argv[0], true);
00077       std::istringstream str(argv[m]);
00078       char c;
00079       if (!(str >> d) || (str >> c) || d <= 0) {
00080         std::cerr << "Number of dimensions " << argv[m]
00081                   << " is not a positive number\n";
00082         return 1;
00083       }
00084     } else if (arg == "-n") {
00085       if (++m == argc) return usage(argv[0], true);
00086       std::istringstream str(argv[m]);
00087       char c;
00088       double fn;
00089       if (!(str >> fn) || (str >> c) || fn < 1 ||
00090           fn > double(std::numeric_limits<long long>::max())) {
00091         std::cerr << "Total count " << argv[m] << " is not a positive number\n";
00092         return 1;
00093       }
00094       n = (long long)(fn);
00095     } else  if (arg == "-k") {
00096       if (++m == argc) return usage(argv[0], true);
00097       std::istringstream str(argv[m]);
00098       char c;
00099       if (!(str >> k) || (str >> c) || k <= 0) {
00100         std::cerr << "Number of tasks " << argv[m]
00101                   << " is not a positive number\n";
00102         return 1;
00103       }
00104     } else  if (arg == "-l") {
00105       if (++m == argc) return usage(argv[0], true);
00106       std::istringstream str(argv[m]);
00107       char c;
00108       if (!(str >> l) || (str >> c) || l <= 0) {
00109         std::cerr << "Leapfrog stride " << argv[m]
00110                   << " is not a positive number\n";
00111         return 1;
00112       }
00113     } else if (arg == "-s") {
00114       seedgiven = true;
00115       if (++m == argc) return usage(argv[0], 1);
00116       seedstr = std::string(argv[m]);
00117     } else
00118       return usage(argv[0], arg != "-h");
00119   }
00120 
00121   std::vector<unsigned long> master_seed =
00122     seedgiven ? Random::StringToVector(seedstr) : Random::SeedVector();
00123 
00124   std::cout << "Estimate volume of a " << d
00125             << "-dimensional sphere;\nsamples = -n " << n
00126             << "; tasks = -k " << k
00127             << "; leapfrog stride = -l " << l << ";\nusing " << Random::Name()
00128             << "\nwith master seed = -s "
00129             << Random::VectorToString(master_seed) << ".\n";
00130   std::cout << "Estimated volume = "
00131             << std::fixed << std::setprecision(8) << std::flush;
00132 
00133   // Reserve room for a task id at the end of the seed
00134   master_seed.push_back(0);
00135   // Fill weight vector with NaNs to verify that all tasks have completed
00136   std::vector<double> w(k, std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN());
00137 
00138 #if HAVE_OPENMP
00139 #pragma omp parallel for
00140 #endif
00141   for (int i = 0; i < k; ++i) { // the main loop over tasks
00142     Random r;                   // task specific Random
00143     {
00144       std::vector<unsigned long> seed(master_seed); // task specific seed
00145       seed.back() = i / l;      // include task id in seed
00146       r.Reseed(seed);
00147       // Turn on leapfrogging with an offset that depends on the task id
00148       r.SetStride(l, i % l);
00149     }
00150     // Do the work; last argument splits n exactly into k pieces
00151     w[i] = dotrials(r, d, (n * (i + 1))/k - (n * i)/k);
00152   }
00153   // Sum up the weights from the individual tasks
00154   double weight = accumulate(w.begin(), w.end(), 0.0);
00155   // Compute the result
00156   std::cout << result(d, n, weight) << "\n";
00157 
00158   return 0;
00159 }
